result.execSummary:
The defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees including DNA by 09-27-16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renaldo Valdez Wilson

records.addlTxt: Defendant is deceased as of 2/17/17.  sb

records.addlTxt: Letter to DOC in response to request for sentence credit review.
DOC request to review sentence credit.

Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.
Filed in 14CM2969.crt

Defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson in custody. Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case or the purposes of sentencing.
 
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson not in court, in custody not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. aa   Status conference held off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Walgreens in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Renaldo Valdez Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
